greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) of n X n binary matrices with k=0..n^2 ones under action of dihedral group of the square D_4.
comment: Cycle indices for n=2,3,4,5 respectively are:
Also the number of equivalence classes of ways of placing k 1 X 1 tiles in an n X n square under all symmetry operations of the square. - _Christopher Hunt Gribble_, Feb 17 2014
The cycle index G(n) for a square n X n grid with squares coming in two colors with k squares of one color is for the D_4 group (with 8 elements R(90)^j, S R(90)^j, j=0..3)
See the above comment by _Geoffrey Critzer_ for n=2..5.
The figure counting series is c(x) = 1 + x for coloring, say black and white.

Therefore the counting series is C(n,x) = G(n) with substitution s[2^j] = c(x^(2*j)) = 1 + x^(2^j) for j=0,1,2. Row n gives the coefficients of C(n,x) in rising (or falling) order.  This follows from Pólya's counting theorem.  See the Harary-Palmer reference, p. 42, eq. (2.4.6), and eq. (2.2.11) with n=4 on p. 37 for the cycle index of D_4.
reference: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Graphical Enumeration, Academic Press, NY, 1973, p. 42, (2.4.6), p. 37, (2.2.11).
link: Index entries for sequences related to groups
example: T(3,2) = 8 because there are 8 nonisomorphic 3 X 3 binary matrices with two ones under action of D_4:
mathematica: GraphData[{"Grid", {n, n}}, "AutomorphismGroup"],Table[Subscript[s, i], {i, 1, 4}]] /. Table[Subscript[s, i] -> 1 + x^i, {i, 1, 4}], x], {n, 2, 10}], {1, 1}], {1}] // Grid (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Aug 09 2016 *)
program: if n == 0 or k == 0 or k == n*n:
[T(n, k) for n in range(6) for k in range(n*n + 1)] # _Freddy Barrera_, Nov 23 2018
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 04 2000
